request.description:
### Search recipes by calorie

Use this endpoint to retrieve paginated recipes filtered by their calorie content. The response includes basic recipe metadata (title, cuisine, rating, times) and a nutrients field with calories and other nutrition info.

- Method: `GET`
    
- URL: `http://127.0.0.1:8000/recipes/search`
    

#### Query parameters

- `calorie` (string, optional): Filter by calorie value using comparison operators. Supported examples observed in this workspace: `<300`, `>80`, `=80`.
    
- as **rating** is not specified,items are sorted in descending order by default
    

Note: Operators are placed directly before the number or value (e.g., `?calorie=<300`).

#### Pagination

The response contains:

- `page`: current page number
    
- `limit`: items per page
    
- `total_results`: total matching items
    
- `total_pages`: number of pages
    
- `results`: array of recipe objects
    

#### Example requests

- Filter recipes under 300 kcal: `GET /recipes/search?calorie=<300`
    
- Filter recipes over 80 kcal: `GET /recipes/search?calorie=>80`
    

#### Sample response (truncated)

``` json
{
  "page": 1,
  "limit": 10,
  "total_results": 4443,
  "total_pages": 445,
  "results": [
    {
      "cuisine": "Hanukkah Kugel",
      "title": "Harvest Noodle Pudding - Fruit Kugel",
      "rating": 5,
      "id": 7890,
      "prep_time": 15,
      "cook_time": 45,
      "total_time": 120,
      "nutrients": "{\"calories\": \"228 kcal\", ... }"
    },
    {
      "cuisine": "Tex-Mex Recipes",
      "title": "Authentic Fire-Roasted Tex-Mex Salsa",
      "rating": 5,
      "id": 8295,
      "total_time": 20,
      "nutrients": "{\"calories\": \"14 kcal\" ... }"
    }
  ]
}

 ```

#### Related requests in this collection

- search by rating
    
- search-total_time
    
- search-calorie (this request)
    
- search by title
    
- search by cuisine
    

These related requests illustrate additional parameters and accepted operator formats used across this API.

## Search recipes by total_time

Use this endpoint to filter recipes by total preparation time.

- Method: GET
    
- URL: `http://127.0.0.1:8000/recipes/search`
    
- Query parameter: `total_time` accepts comparison operators followed by a number of minutes.
    

### Parameters

- `total_time` (string, optional) — Filter by total minutes. Supported prefixes:
    
    - `>N` — recipes with total_time strictly greater than N minutes.
        

```
- ``` `` `=N` — recipes with total_time exactly N minutes (if supported by your backend). `` ```

 ```

`` `Examples:` ``

- ``` `` `?total_time=>80` — recipes taking more than 80 minutes. `` ```
    
- ``` `` `?total_time=<80` — recipes taking less than 80 minutes. `` ```
    
- ``` `` `?total_time=>1900` — extreme filter useful for boundary testing. `` ```
    

### `` `Notes` ``

- `` `200 OK with a JSON array of recipe objects on success.` ``
    
- `` `4xx for invalid operator or malformed value.` ``

## Search recipes (any parameter)

Endpoint  
GET [http://127.0.0.1:8000/recipes/search](http://127.0.0.1:8000/recipes/search)

Purpose  
Search the recipes by one or more query parameters. At least one search parameter is required; otherwise, the API returns 400.

Query parameters

- title (string): partial, case-insensitive match on recipe title. Example: ?title=honey
    
- cuisine (string): filter by cuisine name. Example: ?cuisine=Southern
    
- rating (number with operator): supports operators >, =. Examples: ?rating=>3, ?rating==3
    
- calorie (number with operator): supports operators <, >, =. Examples: ?calorie=<300, ?calorie=>80, ?calorie==80
    
- total_time (number with operator, minutes): supports operators <, >. Examples: ?total_time=<80, ?total_time=>80
    

Notes on operators  
Provide the comparator inline as a prefix (or equality as ==) to the numeric value, e.g., "<300", ">80", or "=80". Multiple parameters can be combined: e.g., ?cuisine=Southern&calorie=<300&rating=>3.

Examples

- By title: /recipes/search?title=honey (see related request: search by title)
    
- By cuisine: /recipes/search?cuisine=Southern (see related request: search by cuisine)
    
- By rating: /recipes/search?rating=>3 (see related request: search by rating)
    
- By calories: /recipes/search?calorie=<300 (see related request: search-calorie)
    
- By total time: /recipes/search?total_time=<80 (see related request: search-total_time)
    

Expected responses

- 200 OK: Array of recipe objects matching the filters.
    
- 400 Bad Request: Returned when no query parameters are provided. Example body: {  
    "detail": "At least one search parameter is required"  
    }
    

Related requests in this collection

- search by rating
    
- search-total_time
    
- search-calorie
    
- search by title
    
- search by cuisine
    

Testing hints

- Add different combinations of parameters to validate intersection filtering.
    
- If you receive 400, ensure you are providing at least one of the documented parameters.

Endpoint: GET /recipes  
Base URL: [http://127.0.0.1:8000](http://127.0.0.1:8000)

Purpose  
Fetch a paginated list of recipe summaries.

Query parameters

- page (integer, optional): Page number to retrieve. Default: 1.
    
- limit (integer, optional): Number of items per page. Default: 10.
    
- rating (integer, optional): Filter recipes by rating (e.g., 5).
    
- cuisine (string, optional): Filter by cuisine/category name (e.g., "Tex-Mex Recipes").
    
- title (string, optional): Filter by recipe title (partial match allowed).
    
- total_time (integer, optional): Filter by total_time in minutes.
    

Successful response (200) example structure  
{  
"page": 1,  
"limit": 10,  
"total": 8451,  
"total_pages": 846,  
"recipes": \[  
{  
"cuisine": "Breakfast Potatoes",  
"title": "Crispy (No-Fry) Potato Pancake Poppers",  
"rating": 5,  
"id": 6036,  
"prep_time": 20,  
"description": "...",  
"serves": "6 servings",  
"cook_time": 40,  
"total_time": 70,  
"nutrients": "{"calories": "204 kcal", "fatContent": "..."}"  
}  
// ...more recipe items  
\]  
}

Notes

- The nutrients field is a JSON string; parse if needed.
    
- Additional filters may be supported by the API; see other requests in this collection for examples.

Overview  
Search recipes by one or more filters such as cuisine, title keywords, rating, total_time, and calorie. Returns a paginated list of matching recipes with core metadata and a summary of results.

Base URL and Endpoint

- Base URL: [http://127.0.0.1:8000](http://127.0.0.1:8000)
    
- Endpoint: /recipes/search
    
- Example full URL: [http://127.0.0.1:8000/recipes/search?cuisine=Southern](http://127.0.0.1:8000/recipes/search?cuisine=Southern)
    

HTTP Method

- GET
    

Supported query parameters  
You can combine multiple parameters. All parameters are optional.

- title: string keyword to match recipe titles.
    
    - Example: title=honey
        
    - See related request: "search by title"
        
- cuisine: string specifying cuisine or category.
    
    - Example: cuisine=Southern
        
    - See related request: "search by cuisine"
        
- rating: numeric comparison operator and value. Supported operators include >, <, = (no spaces).
    
    - Examples: rating=>3, rating==3
        
    - See related request: "search by rating"
        
- total_time: numeric comparison operator and value representing total preparation + cook time in minutes.
    
    - Examples: total_time=<80, total_time=>80, total_time=>1900
        
    - See related request: "search-total_time"
        
- calorie: numeric comparison operator and value. Parsed from the recipe nutrient summary (per serving kcal).
    
    - Examples: calorie=>80, calorie==80, calorie=<300
        
    - See related request: "search-calorie"
        

Notes on operators

- Comparison operators should immediately precede the number (e.g., ">80", "<300", "=3").
    
- Multiple filters are ANDed together.
    
- Unknown parameters are ignored.
    

Response schema (key fields)  
A successful response returns JSON with these top-level fields:

- page: number (current page)
    
- limit: number (page size)
    
- total_results: number (count of matching results)
    
- total_pages: number (derived from total_results and limit)
    
- results: array of Recipe objects
    

Recipe object fields (commonly present):

- id: number (unique identifier)
    
- title: string
    
- cuisine: string
    
- rating: number (e.g., 0–5)
    
- description: string (may be truncated)
    
- serves: string (e.g., "4 servings")
    
- prep_time: number (minutes)
    
- cook_time: number | null (minutes)
    
- total_time: number (minutes)
    
- nutrients: stringified JSON of nutrition facts (e.g., {"calories": "622 kcal", ...})
    

Sample success response (truncated)  
{  
"page": 1,  
"limit": 10,  
"total_results": 769,  
"total_pages": 77,  
"results": \[  
{  
"cuisine": "Southern Pork Main Dishes",  
"title": "Black-Eyed Peas with Ham",  
"rating": 5,  
"id": 1090,  
"prep_time": 20,  
"description": "Similar to hoppin' John, this is a great...",  
"serves": "4 servings",  
"cook_time": 145,  
"total_time": 645,  
"nutrients": "{"calories": "622 kcal", ...}"  
},  
{ "cuisine": "Southern Soups and Stews", "title": "Chef John's Brunswick Stew", "rating": 5, "id": 1137, "prep_time": 15, "cook_time": 135, "total_time": 150, "serves": "6 servings", "description": "Chef John's take on a Southern classic s...", "nutrients": "{...}" }  
\]  
}

Additional notes

- Pagination control via page/limit may be supported globally; if absent, defaults are applied by the service.
    
- Nutrients is a serialized JSON string; parse if needed in client code.
    
- Examples and parameter/operator guidance are informed by the related requests: "search by rating", "search-total_time", "search-calorie", "search by title", and "search by cuisine".

Search recipes by rating.

Endpoint  
GET [http://127.0.0.1:8000/recipes/search](http://127.0.0.1:8000/recipes/search)

Query parameters

- rating: Filter by numeric rating. Supported operators: >, <, =.
    - Examples: rating=>3, rating==3
        
- title: Optional title keyword filter (e.g., title=honey).
    
- cuisine: Optional cuisine/category filter (e.g., cuisine=Southern).
    
- total_time: Optional total time filter with operators >, < (e.g., total_time<80, total_time>1900).
    
- calorie: Optional calories filter with operators >, <, = (e.g., calorie<300, calorie=80).
    

Usage examples

- Exactly 3-star recipes: /recipes/search?rating==3
    
- Above 3-star recipes: /recipes/search?rating=>3
    
- Combine filters: /recipes/search?rating=>3&cuisine=Southern&title=honey
    

Response  
A paginated list of recipes. Example shape:  
{  
"page": 1,  
"limit": 10,  
"total_results": 50,  
"total_pages": 5,  
"results": \[  
{  
"id": 233,  
"title": "Peach Crumble Cake",  
"cuisine": "Peach Crisps and Crumbles",  
"rating": 3,  
"prep_time": 10,  
"cook_time": 30,  
"total_time": 40,  
"serves": "6 servings",  
"nutrients": "{"calories": "852 kcal", ...}"  
}  
\]  
}

Notes

- Variables are supported; use {{variableName}} in URLs or params if needed.
    
- Authentication: Not required for this local endpoint unless configured otherwise.

### Recipes: Search by Title

Search the recipes catalog by title text. This endpoint returns paginated results where the recipe title contains the provided search term.

- Method: `GET`
- URL: `http://127.0.0.1:8000/recipes/search`

#### Query parameters
- `title` (string, optional) — Title substring to search. Example: `honey`.
- `cuisine` (string, optional) — Filter by cuisine name. Example: `Southern`. See related request: [search by cuisine](request/49919794-b72ad730-0528-4d0a-bcc3-0662e1ea6db1).
- `rating` (string, optional) — Comparison operator with numeric rating. Examples: `>3`, `=3`. See related request: [search by rating](request/49919794-64592343-8e63-457b-b292-90743f56861e).
- `total_time` (string, optional) — Comparison operator with total time in minutes. Examples: `<80`, `>80`, `>1900`. See related request: [search-total_time](request/49919794-a920d871-0ab1-4f90-aac6-3029a0428e65).
- `calorie` (string, optional) — Comparison operator with calories per serving. Examples: `>80`, `=80`, `<300`. See related request: [search-calorie](request/49919794-24c5e6d0-22a9-4959-a6aa-a6add0b720f1).

You can also try an all-parameters example here: [search by all](request/49919794-d0f694e8-2db5-464e-aa60-4291306c97a9) or a generic search: [search-any parameter](request/49919794-f8ceed82-07ee-4516-8d49-d59a490ddfb4).

#### Example request
```
GET /recipes/search?title=honey
Host: 127.0.0.1:8000
```

#### Successful response (200)
Response is paginated. Fields:
- `page` (number) — Current page index.
- `limit` (number) — Page size.
- `total_results` (number) — Total matches.
- `total_pages` (number) — Total pages.
- `results` (array of Recipe) — Matching recipes. Each recipe may include:
  - `id` (number)
  - `title` (string)
  - `cuisine` (string)
  - `rating` (number)
  - `prep_time` (number | null)
  - `cook_time` (number | null)
  - `total_time` (number | null)
  - `serves` (string | null)
  - `description` (string | null)
  - `nutrients` (string | object) — Source data may be a stringified JSON.

#### Notes
- Comparison-style parameters accept operators like `>`, `<`, and `=` followed by a number.
- Combine parameters to narrow results (e.g., `title=honey&rating=>3&total_time=<80`).

#### Related requests in this collection
- [search by title](request/49919794-956234e5-a4c2-4a28-b8bc-11cbb947adef) — this request.
- [search by cuisine](request/49919794-b72ad730-0528-4d0a-bcc3-0662e1ea6db1).
- [search by rating](request/49919794-64592343-8e63-457b-b292-90743f56861e).
- [search-total_time](request/49919794-a920d871-0ab1-4f90-aac6-3029a0428e65).
- [search-calorie](request/49919794-24c5e6d0-22a9-4959-a6aa-a6add0b720f1).
- [search by all](request/49919794-d0f694e8-2db5-464e-aa60-4291306c97a9).
- [search-any parameter](request/49919794-f8ceed82-07ee-4516-8d49-d59a490ddfb4).

# Recipe Service – New Request

## Overview

This request is part of the Recipe_Assessment collection and is intended to query the Recipe Service API. The URL/method will be defined in this request tab. This description documents how to use and extend this request without changing its behavior.

## Usage

- Ensure the appropriate environment is selected if this request uses variables like `{{baseUrl}}` or `{{apiKey}}`.
    
- Send the request to retrieve recipe data based on configured query parameters.
    

## Possible Query Parameters

- `title`: Filter recipes by title text (e.g., "pasta").
    
- `cuisine`: Filter by cuisine type (e.g., "italian").
    
- `rating`: Minimum average rating (number).
    
- `calories`: Maximum calories (number).
    
- `total_time`: Maximum total cooking time in minutes (number).
    

## Headers

- `Accept`: `application/json`
    
- `Content-Type`: `application/json` (if a body is later added)
    
- `Authorization`: `Bearer {{token}}` (if the API requires authentication)
    

## Authentication

This request may require a Bearer token. If so, set an environment variable `token` and configure Authorization to use Bearer Token with value `{{token}}`.

## Responses

- `200 OK`: Returns a JSON list of recipes. Typical shape:
    
    ``` json
      {
      "data": [
        {
          "id": "123",
          "title": "Example Recipe",
          "cuisine": "italian",
          "rating": 4.6,
          "calories": 520,
          "total_time": 30
        }
      ],
      "count": 1
      }
    
     ```
    
- `400 Bad Request`: Invalid query parameters.
    
- `401 Unauthorized`: Missing or invalid authentication.
    
- `404 Not Found`: No recipes match the criteria.
    

## Tips

- Use examples to document different response scenarios (200, 400, 404) once the API behavior is confirmed.
    
- Add test scripts to assert status code and response schema when you’re ready to automate.
    

## Change log

- Initial documentation added by Agent Mode.
